db:abstract.db:para: Provides a global object with useful functions from Qt Multimedia.
This type was introduced in QtMultimedia 5.4.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The QtMultimedia object is a global object with utility functions and properties.
It is not instantiable; to use it, call the members of the global QtMultimedia object directly. For example:

db:section.db:title: [read-only] availableCameras : list<object>
db:section.db:para: This property provides information about the cameras available on the system.
Each object in the list has the following properties:

db:td.db:para: This read-only property holds the unique identifier of the camera.
You can choose which device to use with a Camera object by setting its deviceId property to this value.
This read-only property holds the human-readable name of the camera. You can use this property to display the name of the camera in a user interface.
This read-only property holds the physical position of the camera on the hardware system. Please see Camera.position for more information.
This read-only property holds the physical orientation of the camera sensor. Please see Camera.orientation for more information.

db:note.db:para: This property is static; it is not updated when cameras are added or removed from the system, like USB cameras on a desktop platform.

db:section.db:para: The following example shows how to display a list of available cameras. The user can change the active camera by selecting one of the items in the list.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] defaultCamera : object
db:section.db:para: The defaultCamera object provides information about the default camera on the system.
Its properties are deviceId, displayName, position and orientation. See availableCameras for a description of each of them.
If there is no default camera, defaultCamera.deviceId will contain an empty string.

db:note.db:para: This property is static; it is not updated if the system's default camera changes after the application started.
